channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Go to government: Continue, strengthen consumer protection
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Sen. Bong Go appealed to the government for continued and strengthened protection for consumers as key sectors in the economy reopen, allowing some businesses to operate at a larger capacity in light of the ongoing efforts to overcome the COVID-19 crisis.

item.title: 1-year prescription period sought for cyber libel
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: A ranking lawmaker yesterday proposed a one-year prescription period for the crime of cyber libel.

item.title: No rice importation without Duterte’s approval — Palace
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The Philippines won’t import rice without the approval of President Duterte even if a bidding has been conducted, Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: Initiate probe vs erring execs, PhilHealth chief told
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: The chief of the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. should still initiate administrative investigation of officials and personnel linked to corruption even if there are pending cases against them with the Office of the Ombudsman or with the courts, presidential spokesman Harry Roque Jr. said yesterday.

item.title: ‘Danding irreplaceable as NPC head’
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Nationalist People’s Coalition founding chair Eduardo “Danding” Cojuangco Jr. is irreplaceable, and the NPC will struggle to maintain its strength after his death, Senate President Vicente Sotto III said yesterday.

item.title: Duterte to attend virtual ASEAN meet next week
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte will be participating online in the virtual meeting of leaders of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations on June 26, presidential spokesman Harry Roque Jr. said yesterday.

item.title: PLDT preparing for blended learning scheme in education
item.author: Richmond Mercurio
item.description: Telecommunications giant PLDT Inc. is preparing its network to support the expected surge in demand with the implementation of the blended learning scheme in the education sector.

item.title: US to provide P126 million for Philippines basic education
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: The US will provide $2.5 million (about P126 million) to help the Philippines implement the basic education learning continuity plan amid the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic, the US embassy said yesterday.

item.title: Enrile: Lopezes offered ABS-CBN, Meralco to Marcos
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Former Senate president Juan Ponce Enrile told the House of Representatives this week that the Lopezes offered to the late strongman Ferdinand Marcos their companies ABS-CBN and Manila Electric Co. even before the former president declared martial law in September 1972.

item.title: Manila archdiocese holds first post-ECQ Chrism mass today
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: The Archdiocese of Manila will hold the Chrism mass today, more than two months after it was deferred when Metro Manila was placed under enhanced community quarantine due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
